template.name: jsd_all
template.description: This snippet returns true if the predicate function returns true for all elements in a collection and false otherwise. You can omit the second argument fnif you want to use Booleanas a default value.

template.name: jsd_allEqual
template.description: This snippet checks whether all elements of the array are equal.

template.name: jsd_aprxEqual
template.description: This snippet checks whether two numbers are approximately equal to each other, with a small difference.

template.name: jsd_arrayToCSV
template.description: This snippet converts the elements that donâ€™t have commas or double quotes to strings with comma-separated values.

template.name: jsd_average
template.description: This snippet returns the average of two or more numerical values.

template.name: jsd_averageBy
template.description: This snippet returns the average of an array after initially doing the mapping of each element to a value using a given function.

template.name: jsd_bifurcate
template.description: This snippet splits values into two groups and then puts a truthy element of filterin the first group, and in the second group otherwise.

template.name: jsd_bifurcateBy
template.description: This snippet splits values into two groups, based on a predicate function. If the predicate function returns a truthy value, the element will be placed in the first group. Otherwise, it will be placed in the second group.

template.name: jsd_byteSize
template.description: This snippet returns the length of a string in bytes.

template.name: jsd_capitalize
template.description: This snippet capitalizes the first letter of a string.

template.name: jsd_capitalizeEveryWord
template.description: This snippet capitalizes the first letter of every word in a given string.

template.name: jsd_castArray
template.description: This snippet converts a non-array value into array.

template.name: jsd_compact
template.description: This snippet removes false values from an array.

template.name: jsd_countOccurrences
template.description: This snippet counts the occurrences of a value in an array.

template.name: jsd_createDirectory
template.description: This snippet uses existsSync() to check whether a directory exists and then mkdirSync() to create it if it doesnâ€™t.

template.name: jsd_dayOfYear
template.description: This snippet gets the day of the year from a Dateobject.

template.name: jsd_decapitalize
template.value: /*This snippet turns the first letter of a string into lowercase.*/ const decapitalize = ([first, ...rest]) => first.toLowerCase() + rest.join('') /* decapitalize('FooBar'); // 'fooBar' decapitalize('FooBar'); // 'fooBar */
template.description: This snippet turns the first letter of a string into lowercase.

template.name: jsd_deepFlatten
template.description: This snippet flattens an array recursively.

template.name: jsd_default
template.description: This snippet assigns default values for all properties in an object that are undefined.

template.name: jsd_defer
template.description: This snippet delays the execution of a function until the current call stack is cleared.

template.name: jsd_degToRads
template.description: This code snippet can be used to convert a value from degrees to radians.

template.name: jsd_difference
template.description: This snippet finds the difference between two arrays.

template.name: jsd_differenceBy
template.description: This method returns the difference between two arrays, after applying a given function to each element of both lists.

template.name: jsd_differenceWith
template.description: This snippet removes the values for which the comparator function returns false.

template.name: jsd_digitize
template.description: This snippet gets a number as input and returns an array of its digits.

template.name: jsd_distance
template.description: This snippet returns the distance between two points by calculating the Euclidean distance.

template.name: jsd_dropElements
template.description: This snippet returns a new array with n elements removed from the left.

template.name: jsd_dropRight
template.description: This snippet returns a new array with n elements removed from the right.

template.name: jsd_dropRightWhile
template.description: This snippet removes elements from the right side of an array until the passed function returns true.

template.name: jsd_dropWhile
template.description: This snippet removes elements from an array until the passed function returns true.

template.name: jsd_filterDupElm
template.description: This snippet removes duplicate values in an array.

template.name: jsd_findKey
template.description: This snippet returns the first key that satisfies a given function.

template.name: jsd_findLast
template.description: This snippet returns the last element for which a given function returns a truthy value.

template.name: jsd_flatten
template.description: This snippet flattens an array up to a specified depth using recursion.

template.name: jsd_forEachRight
template.description: This snippet executes a function for each element of an array starting from the arrayâ€™s last element.

template.name: jsd_forOwn
template.description: This snippet iterates on each property of an object and iterates a callback for each one respectively.

template.name: jsd_funcName
template.description: This snippet prints the name of a function into the console.

template.name: jsd_getTime
template.description: This snippet can be used to get the time from a Dateobject as a string.

template.name: jsd_getDayBeetwenDates
template.description: This snippet can be used to find the difference in days between two dates.

template.name: jsd_getType
template.description: This snippet can be used to get the type of a value.

template.name: jsd_headOfList
template.description: This snippet returns the head of a list.

template.name: jsd_indexOfAll
template.description: This snippet can be used to get all indexes of a value in an array, which returns an empty array, in case this value is not included in it.

template.name: jsd_initial
template.description: This snippet returns all elements of an array except the last one.

template.name: jsd_intersection
template.description: This snippet can be used to get an array with elements that are included in two other arrays.

template.name: jsd_intersectionBy
template.description: This snippet can be used to return a list of elements that exist in both arrays, after a particular function has been executed to each element of both arrays.

template.name: jsd_is
template.value: /*This snippet can be used to check if a value is of a particular type.*/ const is = (type, val) => ![, null].includes(val) && val.constructor === type; /* is(Array, [1]); // true is(ArrayBuffer, new ArrayBuffer()); // true is(Map, new Map()); // true is(RegExp, /./g); // true is(Set, new Set()); // true is(WeakMap, new WeakMap()); // true is(WeakSet, new WeakSet()); // true is(String, ''); // true is(String, new String('')); // true is(Number, 1); // true is(Number, new Number(1)); // true is(Boolean, true); // true is(Boolean, new Boolean(true)); // true */
template.description: This snippet can be used to check if a value is of a particular type.

template.name: jsd_isAfterDate
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether a date is after another date.

template.name: jsd_isAnagram
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether a particular string is an anagram with another string.

template.name: jsd_isArrayLike
template.description: This snippet can be used to check if a provided argument is iterable like an array.

template.name: jsd_isBeforeDate
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether a date is before another date.

template.name: jsd_isBoolean
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether an argument is a boolean.

template.name: jsd_isLowerCase
template.description: This snippet can be used to determine whether a string is lower case.

template.name: jsd_isNil
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether a value is null or undefined.

template.name: jsd_isNull
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether a value is null.

template.name: jsd_isNumber
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether a provided value is a number.

template.name: jsd_isObject
template.value: /*This snippet can be used to check whether a provided value is an object. It uses the Object constructor to create an object wrapper for the given value. If it is already an object, then an object type that corresponds to the given value will be returned. Otherwise, a new object will be returned.*/ const isObject = obj => obj === Object(obj); /* isObject([1, 2, 3, 4]); // true isObject([]); // true isObject(['Hello!']); // true isObject({ a: 1 }); // true isObject({}); // true isObject(true); // false */
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether a provided value is an object. It uses the Object constructor to create an object wrapper for the given value.

template.name: jsd_isObjectLike
template.description: This snippet can be used to check if a value is not nulland that its typeof is â€œobjectâ€.

template.name: jsd_isPlainObject
template.description: This snippet checks whether a value is an object created by the Object constructor.

template.name: jsd_isPromiseLike
template.description: This snippet checks whether an object looks like a Promise.

template.name: jsd_isSameDate
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether two dates are equal.

template.name: jsd_isString
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether an argument is a string.

template.name: jsd_isUndefined
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether a value is undefined.

template.name: jsd_isUpperCase
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether a string is upper case.

template.name: jsd_isValidJSON
template.description: This snippet can be used to check whether a string is a valid JSON.

template.name: jsd_last
template.description: This snippet returns the last element of an array.

template.name: jsd_matchesObj
template.description: This snippet compares two objects to determine if the first one contains the same property values as the second one.

template.name: jsd_maxDate
template.description: This snippet can be used to get the latest date.

template.name: jsd_maxN
template.description: This snippet returns the n largest elements from a list. If nis greater than or equal to the listâ€™s length, then it will return the original list (sorted in descending order).

template.name: jsd_minDate
template.description: This snippet can be used to get the earliest date.

template.name: jsd_minN
template.description: This snippet returns the n smallest elements from a list. If nis greater than or equal to the listâ€™s length, then it will return the original list (sorted in ascending order).

template.name: jsd_negate
template.description: This snippet can be used to apply the not operator (!) to a predicate function with its arguments.

template.name: jsd_radsToDegrees
template.description: This snippet can be used to convert an angle from radians to degrees.

template.name: jsd_randomHexColor
template.description: This snippet can be used to generate a random hexadecimal color code.

template.name: jsd_randomIntArrayInRange
template.description: This snippet can be used to generate an array with n random integers in a specified range.

template.name: jsd_randomNumberInRange
template.description: This snippet can be used to return a random number in a specified range.

template.name: jsd_readFileLines
template.description: This snippet can be used to read a file by getting an array of lines from a file.

template.name: jsd_reverse
template.description: This snippet can be used to reverse a string.

template.name: jsd_round
template.description: This snippet can be used to round a number to a specified number of digits.

template.name: jsd_rndGetFromArray
template.description: This snippet can be used to get a random number from an array.

template.name: jsd_sampleSizeArray
template.description: This snippet can be used to get nrandom elements from unique positions from an array up to the size of the array. Elements in the array are shuffled using the Fisher-Yates algorithm
